When you’re expecting a baby in the family, it’s very tempting to buy every teeny-tiny outfit and cuddly teddy you can lay hands on. Truth is, most moms end up with a lot of things they don’t use, so it’s a good idea to plan ahead and get the things that really matter rather than a whole lot of ‘nice-to-haves’.
Browse HomeChoice’s extended baby range
Sleepy time for baby & Mom
  • Sleep tight
    • A cot is secure because of its high sides, perfect for when your baby learns to stand, while a co-sleeper allows you to reach out and make sure everything is okay while you sleep in your own bed. The best of both worlds is a cot with a removable side like the Chicco Next To Me cot. A good idea is to use a travel cot because of the mesh sides that are breathable and soft, keeping baby safe and comfortable without cot bumpers or pillows.
  • Snuggle tight
    • Your nursery can look as beautiful as the rest of your home with HomeChoice’s wide range of baby bedding sets and baby blankets. What I recommend is that you get a few baby blankets for winding and swaddling your baby. Wrapping a baby in a blanket helps him/her feel calm and fall asleep quickly. I like the Hug Me mink blanket set because it gives you 3 super-soft mink blankets for the price of 2.
  • Rock-a-bye baby
    • I’m not sure everyone will agree with me that a baby rocker is essential, but anything that helps soothe a crying baby is essential to me!
  • Catching some z’s
    • Moms need to take a nap whenever they can. That’s why I think it’s important to have a super-soft mink blanket handy throughout the day. Pregnant ladies and new moms will also get lots of much-needed comfort and support from the Caresse body pillow set (a great gift from Dad – hint, hint).

    Out & about
  • Going places or going to sleep
    • You can also rock your baby to sleep wearing a baby carrier or take them for a ride in a car seat or pram. The Chelino Coco Jogger pram is great because it supports your baby’s head, is easy to manoeuvre and has lots of storage space in the back.
  • Ready for anything
    • You’re going to need a big bag to put all of baby’s supplies in whenever you leave the house. Mommy bags are perfect because they have compartments for bottles to stay upright, nappy holders and other features moms love.
    Out & about
  • Going places or going to sleep
    • You can also rock your baby to sleep wearing a baby carrier or take them for a ride in a car seat or pram. The Chelino Coco Jogger pram is great because it supports your baby’s head, is easy to manoeuvre and has lots of storage space in the back.
  • Ready for anything
    • You’re going to need a big bag to put all of baby’s supplies in whenever you leave the house. Mommy bags are perfect because they have compartments for bottles to stay upright, nappy holders and other features moms love.
    Bathing & cleaning bums
  • Getting clean
    • A changing mat and a baby bath are essential, but it is quite nice to have both in one. A baby bath and changing unit saves you space and gives you extra storage, which you’ll need, I promise.
  • Drying off
    • Hooded baby towels are very cute, but a hand towel or face cloth also does the job. You might as well get one of the HomeChoice baby hampers which include hooded towels, baby blankets, mommy bags, carriers, playmats and clothes. They’re good value for money (and make great gifts, too).
  • Smelly business
    • You will never have enough nappies, bum cream or wet wipes! Start off with newborn nappies and 1 size larger (some babies are born big). It also helps to have a hands-free bin next to your changing station.
    Bathing & cleaning bums

    Feeding time
  • Milky moments
    • It’s a good idea to have a set of baby bottles even if it’s just for emergencies. You’ll also need a breast pump and sterilising system for any bottling you do.
    Remember to ask your doctor about what medicine and emergency supplies you should have before baby is born, and after that… maybe just get a few outfits and teddy bears.
